citations.narrative:
The licensee was not keeping medical records, cage cards, or APHIS 7005s for puppies born on the premises after the
puppies were sold. There is one litter of 5 day old puppies that had not yet had a cage card, medical record or APHIS
7005 filled out for the litter.
Accurate record keeping is crucial for ensuring a thorough inspection and needed to rapidly identify and trace animals in a
potential disease outbreak.
Each dealer/breeder shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose required
information concerning each dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her
possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer
or exhibitor. Required information can be found in 9 CFR AWA 2.75 (a) (1) (i-ix).
Correction Date: March 12th, 2025 forward.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 11th, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee was not keeping medical records, cage cards, or APHIS 7005s for puppies born on the premises after the 
puppies were sold. There is one litter of 5 day old puppies that had not yet had a cage card, medical record or APHIS 
7005 filled out for the litter. 
Accurate record keeping is crucial for ensuring a thorough inspection and needed to rapidly identify and trace animals in a 
potential disease outbreak. 
Each dealer/breeder shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose required 
information concerning each dog or cat purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her 
possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer 
or exhibitor. Required information can be found in 9 CFR AWA 2.75 (a) (1) (i-ix). 
Correction Date: March 12th, 2025 forward. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 11th, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
